author: passthenachos
title: Content Synchronization using Audio
description: Les médias sont souvent réutilisés en de nombreux petits morceaux. Les détenteurs de droits sur le contenu ont besoin d'un moyen de valider la consommation de leurs médias dans les réseaux distribués.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is still just an idea without a plan or specific product on how the team validates media products with fingerprints through the hashing mechanism. Because I don't know what the proposal's product is, I can't see how much impact the proposal actually has
f6_assessments.q1:
"Proposer states that The founding team holds over 20 US patents, 2 Technical Emmys, 1 Oscar, Multiple exits, existing web 2.0 Series B funds with A list clients.
The numbers and experiences are terrible but there is no github, twitter, telegram or any other information to prove those experiences to be true.
Besides, the detailed plan is still ""coming soon""."
f6_assessments.q2: No plan, no road map, no key metrics and no way to audit

f6_assessments.q0: The problem in the proposal is within this challenge. But there is no detailed plan or key metrics to assess how this proposal impacts Cardano ecosystem. For this idea, my recommendation about key metrics they can choose is about the number of assets, users that use the system, or transaction, total value in the market... that all will value the Cardano ecosystem and align with the challenge.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no implementation plan and detailed explanations about what they want to do. Even have no idea so I cannot give any advice for the detailed plan they would have. 
My guide is that for assessing the feasibility of the proposal, the team should have a roadmap with a realistic timeline that they can adapt with their team. The budget should fit with the plan and be reasonable. 
Moreover, showing some relevant risks with the detailed implementation plan will be appreciated from CA, vCA because it helps to assess the feasibility better.
f6_assessments.q2:
For helping Catalyst community audit the proposal, the team should give a detailed roadmap with a timeline that is realistic with the ability of team members. This proposal doesn't have these things, that's the reason why this proposal cannot be audited. 
One more thing that the team doesn't have here is a detailed explanation about the problem and a solution that to show how they are well-knowing and addressing the problem.

f6_assessments.q0: Incomplete proposal. Problem statement and solution lack detail. No concrete use cases given.
f6_assessments.q1: The relevance of the team's experience is questionable. The incomplete proposal makes me think they lack the motivation and experience to execute their vision.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal is incomplete and lacks details necessary for auditing.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal focuses on whisper fingerprints media to min-hashes allowing the identification of the asset from client node fingerprints to create sync and lookup. The problem statement [Content rights holders need a way to validate consumption of their media in distributed networks] is not explained in detail. Because this proposal is incomplete the solution direction is very abstract, however, it is worth trying for completing in the following fund. Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's impact, and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q1: This team's profile is not provided, and, there is no proof/link for verification. As a result, definitely, there are no grounds to agree on the feasibility of this proposal, however, my only advice would be: in case it is necessary to complete this proposal in the next Catalysts in the future, the proposer should pay attention to ensure that the following components are fully met: (i) Goals and target; (2) road map (integrated with measurable KPIs/metrics); (3) Budget breakdown; (4) Risk and challenge. Based on the given information, I disagree with this proposal's feasible, and would give it a score of 2.
f6_assessments.q2: For an incomplete proposal like this, auditability/transparency can't be guaranteed. Therefore, based on the given information, I strongly disagree with this proposal's auditability, and would give it a score of 1.
